Articles.Content: I need this for the Leeroy booster. To put in custom sounds, do you just put the sounds in a folder in the part file then link it to the CFG? If so, what is the folder called?

You put your sound in a folder named sounds in your part\'s folder. Make sure the filename starts with sound_

Then under your FXes, you add the filename of your sound (for instance, sound_jenkins.mp3)(take note so far I know KSP supports MP3 and wav, but I think I saw somewhere that OGGs worked as well), an equal sign, and when you want it to work (the three available tags are active, activate and deactivate).

So, in our case here, it could look like this: 

sound_jenkins.wav = activate

You put your sound in a folder named sounds in your part\'s folder. Make sure the filename starts with sound_

Then under your FXes, you add the filename of your sound (for instance, sound_jenkins.mp3)(take note so far I know KSP supports MP3 and wav, but I think I saw somewhere that OGGs worked as well), an equal sign, and when you want it to work (the three available tags are active, activate and deactivate).

So, in our case here, it could look like this: 

sound_jenkins.wav = activate

what about custom explosive sounds?

My custom sound for the activation didn\'t play, and the deactivate/break sound was distorted horribly.

Project: Leeroy cancelled.

mp3 files don\'t work very well. I\'ve only managed to get custom WAV files to work properly.

Custom explosion sounds are not possible at the moment.
Well if you want, send everything over and I could give it a look, maybe find what\'s wrong with it.
i deleted all my resources for it, sorry.
